intro: Ranunculus rosani, commonly known as the Rosani buttercup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features delicate, palmately divided leaves and showy, yellow flowers with a distinctive central pistil. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its flowers bloom in early spring, adding a vibrant touch to high-altitude landscapes. Ranunculus rosani is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in local ecosystems by supporting pollinators.
